title: 5.1 Master Challenge 3
question: The basic linear search algorithm stops searching as soon as it finds the search item. Modify your linear search implementation so that it finds all occurrences of the search term in the list and returns their indexes as a list. If the search item is not present in the list, it should return an empty list.
__language_type_hint: python - sql - htmlcss - scratch - javascript - R - pseudocode - java

testcases.value:
Case = Test integer sum
input = 1 2 3 5
output = 11

Case = Test integer sum
input = 1
 -2
 3
 5
